Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2011 06:17PM soccermomofthree wrote: The stuff they clean or prep with I believe is yellow.  I was yellow also.  Bruising can also be very yellow.  Also keep in mind bruises can migrate down with time because of gravity...I also had a skin sparing and they do scrape the inside of your skin.  I think that's where so much of the pain comes from.  I don't think yellow is tissue death.  If you saw black appearing that could be a problem.  I kept an eye on my nipples for any sort of black.  I am happy to say they made it :) You just had this surgery your body is working hard to heal. Really good to hear you don't have any angry red spots also!  Take care!
Posts.Title: Help - Bright Yellow Skin!!!!! A_pallens barbe1958

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2011 07:40PM soccermomofthree wrote: Glad your all good!!!
Posts.Title: Help - Bright Yellow Skin!!!!! A_pallens barbe1958

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2013 03:38AM soccermomof4 wrote: oh, thank you! I didn't know if it was in my  head or what... After being diagnosed I thought my head might be making it feel worse then normal...
Posts.Title: still sore from biopsy? soccermomof4 soccermomof4

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2011 03:40PM soccermomofthree wrote: I have not known any of my friends or family to have pain with their breast cancer.  I do know there is a particular type that does cause pain.  I think you should have a mammogram, sonogram, or MRI,which ever is appropriate,to check out what it is. I always thought to myself that pain was actually a good sign.  I had painful lumps in my breasts and those turned out to be cysts. I think it is good to follow up on these things and that will ease your mind!
Posts.Title: Please help, did your lump hurt? Betterwannabe mtks

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2013 01:03AM soccermomof4 wrote: To each & everyone of you who have posted here - Thank you so much  - I am soaking in each & every word through tears that all of you who don't even know me are taking the time to encourage me! God is working already! I will keep reading these to keep up my spirits.
Posts.Title: My daughters tears are killing me.... soccermomof4 lekker

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2013 07:15PM - edited Jun 20, 2013 07:17PM by soccermomof4 I'm still reading all your great advice - I am trying to keep somehwat upbeat, but at times I just burst into tears. It has been a long day already, I have literally been on the phone almost all day trying to fiquere out what to do.   I finally got a call back from the cancer center I really felt comfortable with & they are squeezing me in, so I felt a little peace wash over me & felt God at work. So the plan right now is I am going back to the doctor I've been with so far at 1pm tomorrow. (This doctor will be moving away next month.)  So meanwhile, the center set me up for an MRI tomorrow morning , as long as my insurance precertifies it! SO if you could pray for it all to go through ok so I can have this done tomorrow morning, that would be great! Then I will start with the new doctor at the center on tues. 8am. The lady on the phone at the center was so nice & she said don't worry we are going to take care of you! She really put my mind at ease. Thank you all for praying, at least I feel I have a direction.
Posts.Title: My daughters tears are killing me.... soccermomof4 lekker

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2013 08:06PM - edited Jun 25, 2013 08:07PM by soccermomof4 I wanted to let you know how everything is going for those who are praying. I met with my new cancer center today. I opted for a masectomy after the doctor showed me another small spot that showed up on my MRI. They have me in Stage 1. I am having the MX & then Chemo.  I would appreciate prayers as I navigate this journey. We serve a great God & he is going to shine through this!!!
Posts.Title: My daughters tears are killing me.... soccermomof4 lekker

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2013 10:17PM - edited Jun 19, 2013 10:19PM by soccermomof4 Thank you everyone for the support. My kids are  17, 14, 13, & 10. My girls are 13 & 14 , they are the ones who really took it hard. I told them that I want them to do something for me , I want them to continue to do all the things they are in & not let satan get them down. SO they are gearing up to leave for soccer here soon. They will be a support to me, as they already want to know everything. I don't want to burden them with too much though, as I want them to stay active in all their events.     The "invasive" of the idc scares me a little. So that means it is already spreading right? Also, is there any like questions I should be asking up front? I have been looking at these boards, but what should I absolutely know?     Thank you for your prayers for me, God is good
Posts.Title: My daughters tears are killing me.... soccermomof4 lekker

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2013 12:30PM soccermomof4 wrote: It is good to know I am not alone & that you are all doing this, it gives me strength to know that. It was a rough night telling family, especially my brother as we are pretty close. But I did get some sleep , I think I was emotionally exhausted. I saw on some of the boards that some recommend going to a cancer center, has anyone else moved over to that? My friend told me last night, (she had a lump that was benign) that she went to one & they did ALL the tests in 1 day, she knew that day what it was as they did the mammo, then ultra, then, the biopsy. I am going to look into the one near us today, it might be nice to maybe be able to get faster results & treatment.
Posts.Title: My daughters tears are killing me.... soccermomof4 lekker

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2013 08:39PM soccermomof4 wrote: Thank you Kathy! Yes, I know it is alot of info. I will take a tablet along, but I should be pretty good at it. My oldest son has heart disease & we have been through soooo much with him that I am very use to receiving all the "news". I'm very detailed at wanting to get the info. right. My husband isn't too good with all the info., but between the 2 of us hopefully we'll get most of it. Yes, my one friend was yelling at me this morning to let people take care of me right now, boy what a hard thing to do when you are used to taking care of everyone. I don't like being the middle of a lot of fuss.

Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2013 02:24PM soccermomof4 wrote: Yes, my anxiety has been pretty high & not eating very well. Hopefull that's all it is....
Posts.Title: fever & no energy? soccermomof4 planetbananas

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2013 12:51PM soccermomof4 wrote: Hi - I am in the boat too! I have IDC stage 1, grade 3. I didn't even have the surgery date yet & doctor already said I will be having chemo when I recover from surgery.     I have the same up & down feeling too, one minute I'm like yes I can do this because everyone around me is telling me so, then the next minute I'm sitting there bawling. This morning I had to meet with the anesthesia people & she is asking me questions & I start crying. It is just an emotional roller coaster.     If you feel like crying , then do it. Take a day for yourself & do what you want to do. I took a day & stayed in bed, I just couldn't deal with anymore information.       I (like the lady above) also think TOO much, so I know the chemo will be a must. I've already read too much about it recurring from one little spot they must have missed. So for my peace of mind I will be getting it, even though my whole mind & body is reeling from even the thought of trying to handle it & take care of my family & try to work.    God is my strength right now, I have to continually lean on him each day, sometimes each minute. Feel free to message me....
